result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (4th) and OWI (4th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th) and the other charge, OWI (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffry Lee Lynch was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Application for IID Exemption While in Custody at Portage County Jail
Disbursements Journal Final
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Jeffrey Lee Lynch in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:31 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing today.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

There is an agreement.
Atty Melowski addresses the Court. This is a 4th offense misdemeanor.

Defendant will enter a plea to Count 2.

Atty Melowski states the plea agreement.

Atty Cousins indicates this is the accurate agreement.

State has not filed an amended information, State will file one shortly.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to Count 2 - Amended to 4th Offense PAC Misdemeanor

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Melowski for Defendant.
Parties concur that this is a 4th offense OWI.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed 4th offense OWI misdemeanor
Count 2: Found Guilty of the amended 4th offense PAC misdemeanor

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends 100 days jail for reasons stated on the record.
Atty Melowski makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends 60 days jail for reasons stated on the record.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties, believes the recommendation of the State is fair and reasonable.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Jail sentence of 99 days
Jail credit of 2 days
First 29 days in jail, balance out on electronic home monitor
Eligible for huber while in jail
Drivers License Revoked 31 Months
IID 31 Months in vehicles titled in Defendant's name
Pay a fine of $1,000 plus costs
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Comply with recommendations of the agent with respect to AODA  reassessment if they determined it is appropriate and comply with recommendations  - BAC: .145

Cash bond of $2,500 is to be applied to fine and costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-05-2016 10:30 am
Status conference at 11-16-2015 08:30 am

Exhibit #P1 Certified Copy of JOC and Sentence to the County Jail/Fine from Jefferson County Case #95CT34
   Exhibit #P2 Certified Copy of JOC and Sentence to the County Jail/Fine/Forfeiture from Jefferson County Case #99CT3
   Exhibit #D3 Copy of Order Not Appointing Counsel
Telephone conference at 10-05-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Jeffrey Lee Lynch in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Set today for Motion Hearing in regards to Exclude Defendant's Prior OWI Convictions for Enhancement Purposes and to Suppress for Lack of Probable Cause for Arrest.

3:49 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Melowski makes statements in regards to the 2 motions that he has filed.
Atty Melowski will proceed with the Collateral Attack's Motion today but will keep the other motion held open. 
Atty Melowski makes further statements.
Atty Melowski indicates that there are no transcripts for prior cases but there are minutes sheets.
3:53 p.m.  Atty Cousins has Exhibits #1 & #2 marked. 
Court reviews the marked Exhibits.
Atty Melowski states that he has a document he wants to submit as supplemental information to the 1999 case.
3:55 p.m.  Exhibit #3 is marked for Atty Melowski.
Court reviews Exhibit #3.
Atty Melowski makes additional statements.
Court makes statements to the defense counsel.
Atty Melowski makes statements that his client was not given the opportunity back in 1995 to have an attorney appointed for him when he was denied the assistance of a public defender.
Atty Melowski now makes statements regarding his clients 1999 case.
Atty Cousins will not make any argument at this time until testimony has been provided.
Atty Cousins is waiving argument on prima facia.
Atty Cousins calls the defendant for testimony.
4:04 p.m. Jeffrey Lee Lynch is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Court makes statements and questions the defendant.
4:11 p.m.  Atty Melowski makes statements regarding his exhibit #3.
Atty Cousins now questions the defendant regarding his 1999 case.
4:16 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Melowski.
4:17 p.m.  Witness is excused.
Court makes statements regarding the 1995 case.
Court recieves the exhibits that have been marked.

BY THE COURT:
Motion granted on the 1995 case.
Motion denied on the 1999 case.  Telephone conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing at 09-10-2015 03:30 pm
of Defendant
to Exclude Defendant's Prior OWI Convictions for Enhancement Purposes
to Suppress for Lack of Probable Cause for Arrest
Motion hearing at 08-04-2015 10:00 am
Preliminary Hearing held 3/23/15
Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Deputy F. Chojnacki is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Knaapen. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 

Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files Information.
Defendant waives reading of information subject to the objection previously made to the complaint. 
Court so notes. 

Court enters NOT GUILTY Plea(s).
Atty Melowski asks if the pre-trial can be done by phone. 

Court cannot speak for Judge Finn if it's ok to appear by phone.

Defendant Jeffrey Lee Lynch in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:25 p.m.  Case is called. 

Attorney/Defendant receives a copy of the criminal complaint.
Atty Melowski makes arguments to the Court re: the basis for Count 2. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Melowski moves for Count 2 to be dismissed. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Melowski makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
BY THE COURT:  Both charges stand. 

Atty Melowski stands mute on the charges in the complaint. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
to Appear
Initial appearance on February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

DA Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:28 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 5th Offense.
PBT: .191

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Defendant has not been seen by the public defender's office today.

Court questions Defendant. 

State requests a cash bond $2,500 with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  January 12, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1

Court advises Defendant regarding the next court date.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
